Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as aeb19816e67f6d3ffb1b37c95d813a25b8be1d7b
I see changes in intel.js. Will this change work for other platforms?
Are you planning to add similar role based restrictions to other screens like reboot-bmc, firmware etc?
I am not planning on this. It would be possible for anyone else to add access restrictions as needed in the future. Currently only one limitation was required
Ack
Is it OK to fetch storedPrivilege from localstorage? As anyone can tamper it.
Local storage was removed and replaced with the stores.
How's about applying this to src/router/routes.js also?
and also on src/components/AppNavigation/AppNavigationMixin.js?

This patch set is focused on the Intel environment. According to the intel environment, Web UI has to restrict the virtual media page to non-administrator users. So I have updated this patch according to that.

I would prefer not to add the environmental related changes to the common files.
Do we have "Virtual media" menu disabled when logged by Operator or Readonly user?
In the Intel environment, this patch will disable the Virtual Media menu for all users other than those with administrator privileges.

Can I expect below:
- With root/0penBMC which has Administrator role, the "Virtual media" menu and VirtualMedia page are available.
- With other users created with Readonly or Operator privilege, the "Virtual media" menu and VirtualMedia page are not available

I would like to have similar feature for my platform which use default environment so I will have a change on top of this to enable configuration for default environment.
Done
It seems you also did some unit tests. Can you provide with your test result?

Please see the test results below: 

webui-vue# npm run test:unit

> webui-vue@0.1.0 test:unit
> vue-cli-service test:unit

Done

Hi Siva,
Your change breaks the Virtual Media on common platforms. Below is my test on my platform which uses common environment:

1. Login to the BMC via WebUI using root/0penBMC.
2. Enter Operations -> Virtual media --> the Virtual Media page is loaded successfully.
3. Press the browser's refresh button to reload the page, the page shows "Page not found. The requested resource could not be found"
I have updated the patch to handle the privilege on the router. If the privilege is not available, the user API call will fetch the privilege, and then pages will get navigated.
Patchset 9 works for my Mt.Jade platform.
Ack
Looks good to me but with one minor question.
Is it expected for both the `else if` and `if` to do the same thing?

Good catch! Thanks.
I have updated the patch.
Is there any further feedback, or can this be moved to +2?
If there is no further concerns, shall we move forward to get +2?
